content.description: Start low at a small and overhung right facing corner behind a boulder. Alternatively, stand on the top of the boulder and skip the first few moves. Make a hard move out right, then up the dark-colored face through big moves to good holds or more delicate moves on crimps. From the last bolt, finish straight up (hard) or step left on large (read: chossy) plates, then back right to the anchor.
content.location: Farthest left line of bolts on the immunity wall

content.description:
Nothing too special but it's a fun little pitch that should become popular as it cleans up.

 Begin up a few easy bolts until the terrain gets steeper culminating in a fun mantle. The holds thin out dramatically for the last 15 feet but luckily the angle lessens as well keeping things nicely at the grade.
content.location: 50 feet right of Diplomatic Immunity, just before the property line.

climbs.name: Quinceañera Crack
climbs.fa: ACB: Mischa Tourin, Roderick Russell, Phil England, Thom Corrado, Mike Morin, Isaac Levy, Tara Goreau, Ted Shiele, Kris Fiore, Ryan Sengebush, Emily H

content.description:
Follow the crack as it trends left, meets a nice stance, and then continues straight up to lower off anchor. 

 This route was previously climbed in the mid-90s though the name and First Ascensionists are currently unknown. It was aggressively gardened out by Mischa Tourin and on May 19, 2018 it was climbing by a party of 15 during the Bolton Dome Opening Celebration in an attempt to gain the World Record for largest FA party (except it wasn’t really an FA and this record probably doesn’t exist). Good times where had nonetheless! 

 ACB: Mischa Tourin, Roderick Russell, Phil England, Thom Corrado, Mike Morin, Isaac Levy, Tara Goreau, Ted Shiele, Kris Fiore, Ryan Sengebush, Emily Harwood, Rob Fleming, Ellen Campbell, Seth Maciejowski, and Dylan Fant
content.location: Past the Diplomatic Immunity buttress, just before the property line.Scramble up mossy boulders to the base of a large left leaning crack system and belay in front of a small tree.

content.description:
A fun beginning and end that has an awkward middle that somewhat detracts.

 Work up an easy shallow corner system to an awkward move to the left to gain a stance with a good shake. Take a deep breath and work up through the bulge with increasing difficulty culminating in a very cool crux that guards the anchor.
content.location: There are two routes on the Immunity Wall, this is the right route.

content.description: A short wall that gets a lot of sun. Tends to be a little wet in spring but once it dries it stays that way. Yer Doin' It stays wet much longer than Diplomatic Immunity. Don Jual and Quinceañera Crack are a few feet right around the corner.
